attributes.action: MP's salaries reduced by 10%pwk until they have positive decision on Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
Once a positive direction has been established salaries can return to current levels.
This process should begin from week commencing 29th April 2019
attributes.background:
The national interest is being serious harmed by the continued delays and failure to establish a way forward.
Costs to individuals and businesses are growing and MP's should share this burden.
They can continue to discuss and not reach an agreement but this should not be at the public's cost.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here:

http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/
